verses.text: But Solomon was building his own house thirteen years , and he finished all his house. \p

¶ He built also the house of the forest of Lebanon ; the length thereof \add was\add* an hundred cubits , and the breadth thereof fifty cubits , and the height thereof thirty cubits , upon four rows of cedar pillars , with cedar beams upon the pillars.
And \add it was\add* covered with cedar above upon the beams , that \add lay\add* on forty five pillars , fifteen \add in\add* a row.\f + \fr 7.3 \ft beams: Heb. ribs\f*
And \add there were\add* windows \add in\add* three rows , and light \add was\add* against light \add in\add* three ranks.\f + \fr 7.4 \ft light was…: Heb. sight against sight\f*

And all the doors and posts \add were\add* square , with the windows : and light \add was\add* against light \add in\add* three ranks.\f + \fr 7.5 \ft doors…: or, spaces and pillars were square in prospect\f* \p

¶ And he made a porch of pillars ; the length thereof \add was\add* fifty cubits , and the breadth thereof thirty cubits : and the porch \add was\add* before them: and the \add other\add* pillars and the thick beam \add were\add* before them.\f + \fr 7.6 \ft before them: or, according to them\f* \p

¶ Then he made a porch for the throne where he might judge , \add even\add* the porch of judgment : and \add it was\add* covered with cedar from one side of the floor to the other.\f + \fr 7.7 \ft from…: Heb. from floor to floor\f* \p

¶ And his house where he dwelt \add had\add* another court within the porch , \add which\add* was of the like work. Solomon made also an house for Pharaoh’s daughter , whom he had taken \add to wife\add*, like unto this porch.

All these \add were of\add* costly stones , according to the measures of hewed stones , sawed with saws , within and without , even from the foundation unto the coping , and \add so\add* on the outside toward the great court.
And the foundation \add was of\add* costly stones , even great stones , stones of ten cubits , and stones of eight cubits.
And above \add were\add* costly stones , after the measures of hewed stones , and cedars.

And the great court round about \add was\add* with three rows of hewed stones , and a row of cedar beams , both for the inner court of the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and for the porch of the house. \p
¶ And king Solomon sent and fetched Hiram out of Tyre.\f + \fr 7.13 \ft Hiram: also called, Huram\f*

He \add was\add* a widow’s son of the tribe of Naphtali , and his father \add was\add* a man of Tyre , a worker in brass : and he was filled with wisdom , and understanding , and cunning to work all works in brass. And he came to king Solomon , and wrought all his work.\f + \fr 7.14 \ft a widow’s…: Heb. the son of a widow woman\f*
For he cast two pillars of brass , of eighteen cubits high apiece : and a line of twelve cubits did compass either of them about.\f + \fr 7.15 \ft cast: Heb. fashioned\f*

And he made two chapiters \add of\add* molten brass , to set upon the tops of the pillars : the height of the one chapiter \add was\add* five cubits , and the height of the other chapiter \add was\add* five cubits :
\add And\add* nets of checker work , and wreaths of chain work , for the chapiters which \add were\add* upon the top of the pillars ; seven for the one chapiter , and seven for the other chapiter.
And he made the pillars , and two rows round about upon the one network , to cover the chapiters that \add were\add* upon the top , with pomegranates : and so did he for the other chapiter.
And the chapiters that \add were\add* upon the top of the pillars \add were\add* of lily work in the porch , four cubits.

And the chapiters upon the two pillars \add had pomegranates\add* also above , over against the belly which \add was\add* by the network : and the pomegranates \add were\add* two hundred in rows round about upon the other chapiter.

And he set up the pillars in the porch of the temple : and he set up the right pillar , and called the name thereof Jachin : and he set up the left pillar , and called the name thereof Boaz.\f + \fr 7.21 \ft Jachin: that is, He shall establish\f*\f + \fr 7.21 \ft Boaz: that is, In it is strength\f*
And upon the top of the pillars \add was\add* lily work : so was the work of the pillars finished. \p

¶ And he made a molten sea , ten cubits from the one brim to the other : \add it was\add* round all about , and his height \add was\add* five cubits : and a line of thirty cubits did compass it round about.\f + \fr 7.23 \ft from…: Heb. from his brim to his brim\f*
And under the brim of it round about \add there were\add* knops compassing it, ten in a cubit , compassing the sea round about : the knops \add were\add* cast in two rows , when it was cast.

It stood upon twelve oxen , three looking toward the north , and three looking toward the west , and three looking toward the south , and three looking toward the east : and the sea \add was set\add* above upon them, and all their hinder parts \add were\add* inward.
And it \add was\add* an hand breadth thick , and the brim thereof was wrought like the brim of a cup , with flowers of lilies : it contained two thousand baths. \p
¶ And he made ten bases of brass ; four cubits \add was\add* the length of one base , and four cubits the breadth thereof, and three cubits the height of it.
And the work of the bases \add was\add* on this \add manner:\add* they had borders , and the borders \add were\add* between the ledges :

And on the borders that \add were\add* between the ledges \add were\add* lions , oxen , and cherubims : and upon the ledges \add there was\add* a base above : and beneath the lions and oxen \add were\add* certain additions made of thin work.
And every base had four brasen wheels , and plates of brass : and the four corners thereof had undersetters : under the laver \add were\add* undersetters molten , at the side of every addition.

And the mouth of it within the chapiter and above \add was\add* a cubit : but the mouth thereof \add was\add* round \add after\add* the work of the base , a cubit and an half : and also upon the mouth of it \add were\add* gravings with their borders , foursquare , not round.

And under the borders \add were\add* four wheels ; and the axletrees of the wheels \add were joined\add* to the base : and the height of a wheel \add was\add* a cubit and half a cubit.\f + \fr 7.32 \ft joined…: Heb. in the base\f*
And the work of the wheels \add was\add* like the work of a chariot wheel : their axletrees , and their naves , and their felloes , and their spokes , \add were\add* all molten.
And \add there were\add* four undersetters to the four corners of one base : \add and\add* the undersetters \add were\add* of the very base itself.
And in the top of the base \add was there\add* a round compass of half a cubit high : and on the top of the base the ledges thereof and the borders thereof \add were\add* of the same.

For on the plates of the ledges thereof, and on the borders thereof, he graved cherubims , lions , and palm trees , according to the proportion of every one , and additions round about.\f + \fr 7.36 \ft proportion: Heb. nakedness\f*
After this \add manner\add* he made the ten bases : all of them had one casting , one measure , \add and\add* one size. \p
¶ Then made he ten lavers of brass : one laver contained forty baths : \add and\add* every laver was four cubits : \add and\add* upon every one of the ten bases one laver.

And he put five bases on the right side of the house , and five on the left side of the house : and he set the sea on the right side of the house eastward over against the south.\f + \fr 7.39 \ft side: Heb. shoulder\f* \p

¶ And Hiram made the lavers , and the shovels , and the basons. So Hiram made an end of doing all the work that he made king Solomon for the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*:\f + \fr 7.40 \ft And Hiram: Heb. And Hirom\f*

The two pillars , and the \add two\add* bowls of the chapiters that \add were\add* on the top of the two pillars ; and the two networks , to cover the two bowls of the chapiters which \add were\add* upon the top of the pillars ;

And four hundred pomegranates for the two networks , \add even\add* two rows of pomegranates for one network , to cover the two bowls of the chapiters that \add were\add* upon the pillars ;\f + \fr 7.42 \ft upon…: Heb. upon the face of the pillars\f*
And the ten bases , and ten lavers on the bases ;
And one sea , and twelve oxen under the sea ;

And the pots , and the shovels , and the basons : and all these vessels , which Hiram made to king Solomon for the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add were of\add* bright brass.\f + \fr 7.45 \ft bright: Heb. made bright or, scoured\f*
In the plain of Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zarthan.\f + \fr 7.46 \ft in…: Heb. in the thickness of the ground\f*

And Solomon left all the vessels \add unweighed\add*, because they were exceeding many : neither was the weight of the brass found out.\f + \fr 7.47 \ft because…: Heb. for the exceeding multitude\f*\f + \fr 7.47 \ft found: Heb. searched\f* \p
And Solomon made all the vessels that \add pertained\add* unto the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: the altar of gold , and the table of gold , whereupon the shewbread \add was\add*,
And the candlesticks of pure gold , five on the right \add side\add*, and five on the left , before the oracle , with the flowers , and the lamps , and the tongs \add of\add* gold ,

And the bowls , and the snuffers , and the basons , and the spoons , and the censers \add of\add* pure gold ; and the hinges \add of\add* gold , \add both\add* for the doors of the inner house , the most holy \add place, and\add* for the doors of the house , \add to wit\add*, of the temple.\f + \fr 7.50 \ft censers: Heb. ash pans\f*

So was ended all the work that king Solomon made for the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. And Solomon brought in the things which David his father had dedicated ; \add even\add* the silver , and the gold , and the vessels , did he put among the treasures of the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.  +  r 7.51  t things…: Heb. holy things of David *
